Articles.Content:
This is a long range one way atmospheric lander including a solar powered rover. It is pretty easy to pilot and I got it to Laythe without much problem. The only time i had troubles turning was after staging my outer engines but after getting rid of that huge fuel tank it handles fine. I will admit it is not very advanced but simplicity was my goal. It does not have any RCS, anyway to return, or a way to deorbit/salvage debris. Here is a video of the first two test flights so you can see it in action, and I also added pictures. I made this to start my Youtube Discovery Series. Its main mission will be exploration of anomalies. The first place I am going to fully explore is Laythe. This way I know most of my Discovery pieces have good range. For those of you who do download this thank you very much and I hope you enjoy. I would love to see your own versions. If I like it and you are willing I would like to add your versions of this (and future rockets) to my colonies/videos.

Few minor tips with the nav ball. During flight just control from the unit on the bottom of the lander, and when driving the rover control from docking port for a accurate nav ball.

Download

http://www./download/gr...covery_x.craft

Edited June 16, 2013 by Kerbstomp90
All of your pictures and videos don't work, It sounds great unfortunately lots of people wont download it because of that please fix.
Is anyone else having the same issue? It is working fine for me but if it happens to multiple people I will work on it. Sorry for it not working.
got a lot of 404 and site not working errors
Tried fixing it. Hope it works now

Nice video. Though, you seem to be using Mechjeb. You know you can use the Instrument Landing System to calculate aerobraking manouvers? It saves a whole load of fuel on slowing down into an orbit.

Of course, as of 0.19, it also looks really cool.

Nice video. Though, you seem to be using Mechjeb. You know you can use the Instrument Landing System to calculate aerobraking manouvers? It saves a whole load of fuel on slowing down into an orbit.

Of course, as of 0.19, it also looks really cool.

I mainly just use mechjeb for smart a.s.s lol

There working now, looks good.

Thanks alot!
